elements.2211.03058_9d5493e0bf503a1bcc0b87695dcba: Existing deep learning based HDRTV reconstruction methods assume one kind of tone mapping operators (TMOs) as the degradation procedure to synthesize SDRTV-HDRTV pairs for supervised training
elements.2211.03058_91e7c98971c0e516935a02d6eb024: In this paper, we argue that, although traditional TMOs exploit efficient dynamic range compression priors, they have several drawbacks on modeling the realistic degradation: information over-preservation, color bias and possible artifacts, making the trained reconstruction networks hard to generalize well to real-world cases
elements.2211.03058_3a71dc047891a2c960ae833d10d9a: To solve this problem, we propose a learning-based data synthesis approach to learn the properties of real-world SDRTVs by integrating several tone mapping priors into both network structures and loss functions
elements.2211.03058_7f7b858123b1e95ed4772ff08d5dd: In specific, we design a conditioned two-stream network with prior tone mapping results as a guidance to synthesize SDRTVs by both global and local transformations
elements.2211.03058_e2f70d3dd35547fadd9422e28ba1a: To train the data synthesis network, we form a novel self-supervised content loss to constraint different aspects of the synthesized SDRTVs at regions with different brightness distributions and an adversarial loss to emphasize the details to be more realistic
elements.2211.03058_9f47f7e42fb9c17f69c70ed92d543: To validate the effectiveness of our approach, we synthesize SDRTV-HDRTV pairs with our method and use them to train several HDRTV reconstruction networks
elements.2211.03058_1cfc20a70c4132ef65d09272b17c3: Then we collect two inference datasets containing both labeled and unlabeled real-world SDRTVs, respectively
elements.2211.03058_8c38300611db538261f88865c24f5: Experimental results demonstrate that, the networks trained with our synthesized data generalize significantly better to these two real-world datasets than existing solutions.
elements.2211.03058_364cadfcd9eb7dc315bd435ea590b: Recent years have seen the huge progress on ultra high-definition (UHD) display devices such as OLED
elements.2211.03058_a6af1e1cf5e53edbb8a14b950a1e8: , which can display high dynamic range television sources (HDRTVs) with high dynamic range (HDR,
elements.2211.03058_ebdaee36f00272992c024b25fc87f: , 10 bit quantization) and wide color gamut (WCG,
elements.2211.03058_0228cf713ff3013860bfeb1848930: However, while such HDR display devices (named HDR-TVs) become more popular, most available images/videos are still standard dynamic range television sources (SDRTVs)
elements.2211.03058_d980f8164c46e529b69090281a8a9: focus on recovering the linear and scene radiance maps from the captured sRGB sources, forming the LDR-to-HDR problem defined at the imaging side, as shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03058_74f4edd79cc1fd1236a42ae206a30: Then the scene radiance maps are transformed to HDRTVs via complicated post-processing
elements.2211.03058_8e63a6869895febb2ca77b380f639: However, such post-processing has been not well-defined for the standards of HDRTVs, resulting in severe color bias and artifacts
elements.2211.03058_4ec908508ee7f6ef79843343a59bc: Recently, researchers introduced deep learning techniques to straightforwardly reconstruct HDRTVs from their corresponding SDRTVs
elements.2211.03058_4a918e7ed8bb1947cf61863d38a65: , forming the problem SDRTV-to-HDRTV at the dispalying side (Fig.
elements.2211.03058_07e59df47ff2774f4cede8f8a174b: Such solutions need to train convolutional neural networks (CNNs) relying on SDRTV-HDRTV pairs
elements.2211.03058_d5b51a7ba4675c2f084a3ca60a923: Hence, the acquisition of such paired data becomes a vital problem.
elements.2211.03058_43653b1b50af15944a98d6954009f: There exists two possible ways to get SDRTV-HDRTV pairs: acquisition by cameras and synthesis by algorithms
elements.2211.03058_2aaa47caaf042b3c383283db11a0c: The former acquires SDRTV-HDRTV pairs via asynchronous camera shots like those in super-resolution
elements.2211.03058_cf2f421e0e07536551fb218daa5df: However, such approach faces difficulties to get large datasets for network training due to its high sensitivity to motion and light condition changes
elements.2211.03058_23a3907ec438f08fde228f2484d24: The latter solution can be further divided into two categories: camera pipeline based and tone mapping operator (TMO) based
elements.2211.03058_89b4e62cd7ec6e6694b7af3518e72: Camera pipeline based approaches get the scene radiance map first and then process it to SDRTV and HDRTV via different processing pipelines
elements.2211.03058_e377f3a19dd0478b95c245d83cca1: However, mostly the processing from light radiance to HDRTV is unknown, which makes the solution unavailable
elements.2211.03058_6f51e792d7e1d8461240372ca2e27: In consequence, existing SDRTV-to-HDRTV methods rely on TMOs
elements.2211.03058_6db515495e0cbb532da05aeb5aaf7: that compress the dynamic range via global or local transformations as the degradation procedure to synthesize the SDRTV data
elements.2211.03058_829bee016e71d53ecc7d4b1dfe1d3: However, through detailed analysis, we observe that, because TMOs aim at preserving the information from HDRTVs as much as possible, they may inherit too much information such as extreme-light details from HDRTVs, which often do not appear in real-world SDRTVs
elements.2211.03058_5620cd0bafb526e730dc741f67a2d: Such information over-preservation, as shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03058_e6f5fb9cabf182aeb8445cc46b88d: (a), is the main drawback of TMOs as SDRTV data synthesis solutions
elements.2211.03058_257e5a64d53433d51877c8770daa2: Moreover, most TMOs will also introduce color bias due to inaccurate gamut mapping and obvious artifacts such as wrong structures
elements.2211.03058_8067253f9114987feacf64828042b: Accordingly, the HDRTV reconstruction networks trained by TMO-synthesized SDRTV-HDRTV pairs are hard to generalize well to real-world cases as shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03058_ecff1fbe5f6bf8cc1896080ff2df0: To solve this problem, we propose an learning-based SDRTV data synthesis approach to synthesize realistic SDRTV-HDRTV pairs
elements.2211.03058_05ff5f299f9dae2439a5948391967: Inspired by real-world degradation learning with the help of predefined degradations in super-resolution
elements.2211.03058_04db5406cafceeff396a3df552b65: , we exploit the tone mapping priors in our method for both network structures and loss functions.
elements.2211.03058_045a37d0e42fcbacb88c914f17661: In specific, we model the SDRTV data synthesis with two streams,
elements.2211.03058_86c354e22228fd05d38f5665bd0c1: , a global mapping stream and a local adjustment one and use some representative tone mapping results to generate global guidance information for better HDRTV-to-SDRTV conversion
elements.2211.03058_0f86a4d445ec77e373c41ae238e6c: To train the network, we utilize different tone mapping results as the supervisor for regions with different light conditions, forming a novel unsupervised content loss to constraint different aspects of the synthesized SDRTVs
elements.2211.03058_d1c68dbde25d5ba88a14253994585: We also introduce an adversarial loss to emphasize the synthesized SDRTVs to be more realistic
elements.2211.03058_2c5416d396a1aa71ac96c3c00e906: To validate the effectiveness of our approach, we synthesize SDRTV-HDRTV pairs using our method and use them to train several HDRTV reconstruction networks
elements.2211.03058_ed9d9ef33a71d0dce8643ae58a077: For inference, we collect two inference datasets containing labeled SDRTVs captured by a smartphone and unlabeled SDRTVs from public datasets
elements.2211.03058_cdb998215931f8cd0d7d5c2293310: Quantitative and qualitative experimental results on these two inference datasets demonstrate that, the networks trained with our synthesized data can achieve significantly better performance than those with other data synthesis approaches.
elements.2211.03058_2721bf3f03dce3fed354c62da3cdf: SDRTV-to-HDRTV is a highly ill-posed problem since the complicated degradation from HDRTVs to SDRTVs
elements.2211.03058_9ba80d583846eed4958fff171a1ee: While early researches aim at restoring HDR radiance map from a low dynamic range (LDR) input, which is called inverse tone mapping
elements.2211.03058_53946d25a19c333941434bc602974: , they only consider HDR reconstruction at the imaging side and ignore the color gamut transform
elements.2211.03058_09d442387b601c3c6ca8726975527: Recently, SDRTV-to-HDRTV with deep learning techniques relying on synthesized SDRTV data becomes popular
elements.2211.03058_66ad2fb2791f2270d585898ed378a: In this paper, we focus on the solution of data synthesis for real-world HDRTV reconstruction.
elements.2211.03058_53e3b070eb32f1e86942de2446dd7: TMOs aim at compressing the dynamic range of HDR sources but preserve image details as much as possible
elements.2211.03058_6b8575e81ebb2c12a7fa910ca25b8: Traditional TMOs always involve some useful tone mapping priors such as the Weber-Fechner law
elements.2211.03058_40414db6abfb40cae6fd441025b45: Recently, learning-based TMOs become popular due to their remarkable performance
elements.2211.03058_e6f8fface6848c797a63b0b01152c: They rely on ranking traditional TMOs
elements.2211.03058_548de4bedf7fe9bcdc456c88c7446: as labels for fully supervision or unpaired datasets for adversarial learning
elements.2211.03058_02a0c65a1637a59ca0c402381a7fe: In this paper, we argue that TMOs have several drawbacks for realistic HDRTV data synthesis
elements.2211.03058_bd846052680cc513f1813304cdac9: Accordingly, we propose a learning-based method integrating tone mapping priors to solve these drawbacks.
elements.2211.03058_d1104534ba9a165a99ac3842f22b5: As we all know, the core target of TMOs is to preserve as much information as possible from the HDR sources
elements.2211.03058_4589136b8603107d3afbb3be8ff7e: However, the essential of the degradation from HDRTVs to SDRTVs is to lose information selectively,
elements.2211.03058_fb56c68dc6a6563af7c8109242a53: , drop out details at extreme-light regions
elements.2211.03058_4d05c48401e21d98a7f05af2269d0: Thus sometimes a contradiction will occur when we use TMOs to model the degradation
elements.2211.03058_f6cc6b6264b9f051e8221129066cc: To get a deep-in understanding of this problem, we make an evaluation on 31 TMOs (detailed in the supplementary material) with our RealHDRTV dataset (detailed in Sec.
elements.2211.03058_484c8415baeb127ec50eb53ccebf6: (higher is better), which is mostly used for the evaluations of TMOs, to evaluate the amount of information an SDRTV preserves from the corresponding HDRTV
elements.2211.03058_a41f27e9f922a79b3cd759cb0de15: Meanwhile, we use PSNR (higher is better) and CIEDE-2000
elements.2211.03058_1d09d0482ce972c0a44c191fc469f: (lower is better) to evaluate the distance between a synthesized SDRTV and the ground truth real-world one
elements.2211.03058_186a3e0a169976eb2386a63b07678: We draw the evaluation results averaged over the RealHDRTV dataset to two scatters in Fig.
elements.2211.03058_7c2e5adb30b5870d6fcc7f47559d2: where each point represents a TMO
elements.2211.03058_6783c95fb23b7d5c6bdd7d4669ac5: Interestingly, we can see that, on our RealHDRTV dataset, when the TMQI of a TMO exceeds a threshold at about 0.8, the distance between synthesized and real-world data turns to increase
elements.2211.03058_138928cca1a1621741fb6ea530c25: It indicates that the information preserved by this TMO may be too much compared with realistic SDRTVs
elements.2211.03058_fa45ce158a277b994adcae3d88133: We can also observe such information over-preservation in Fig.
elements.2211.03058_9e86283eff6b50cb98302ab86b694: Such drawback may lead the trained HDRTV reconstruction networks fail to hallucinate the extreme-light details in real-world cases as shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03058_1cac38c7cff695cab6a08de67d446: Moreover, most TMOs transform the color gamut by simple transformation matrix
elements.2211.03058_bf430c8b15c804528c46ba0a57a8a: , resulting obvious color bias, let alone possible artifacts such as halo, wrong structures and color banding occur for most TMOs
elements.2211.03058_b82ba01400fc0a43d10af373c1a47: The data synthesized by TMOs will lead the trained reconstruction network to generate artifacts in real-world cases as shown in Fig.
elements.2211.03058_3fde1055067546332ca7f68c7676a: Motivated by these drawbacks of TMOs on realistic SDRTV data synthesis, we propose a learning-based approach to synthesize training data for better HDRTV reconstruction in real-world cases.
elements.2211.03058_a2d117d6d95d1c6cd10b7ff17df4e: illustrates the framework of our data synthesis method
elements.2211.03058_98b5a66bf4a50e83b5273df0614a3: Inspired by learning real-world degradation with the help of predefined downsampling methods in the field of image super-resolution
elements.2211.03058_b2debb6a4dcc0e2a210b9239ab02e: , we involve the prior knowledge for designing TMOs to our framework
elements.2211.03058_0e0abe258cb75b75e94c250266020: Although these priors themselves cannot be used for straightforward degradation modeling, some of them can provide regional constraints or global guidance to benefit our learning
elements.2211.03058_7a32ed9a41139b3550349f57e3612: Thus, we integrate several tone mapping priors into both network structures and loss functions.

elements.2211.03058_bdd722d659ed861c0a54812c2de0e: , the synthesized SDRTVs should have several aspects: globally compressed dynamic range, accurate color gamut and lost details at extreme-light regions
elements.2211.03058_ac7a84734db763b23118b50940ead: However, there are no paired HDRTV-SDRTV datasets and the acquisition of large-scale and high-quality datasets for training with imaging devices is also difficult

elements.2211.03058_9c26e5d5d24300c7d8d9ab1dd8f03: , we can only make visual comparisons and user study to validate the quality of reconstructed HDRTVs
elements.2211.03058_5335c1c387643a11059c93962c0dd: In order to make full-reference evaluations, we also capture a dataset, named RealHDRTV, containing SDRTV-HDRTV pairs
elements.2211.03058_6a6869b6e43150324744a06908102: Specifically, we capture 93 SDRTV-HDRTV pairs with 8K resolutions using a smartphone camera with the
elements.2211.03058_4539ad93cce1f16f6f3bd8343a3eb: To avoid possible misalignment, we use a professional steady tripod and only capture indoor or controlled static scenes
elements.2211.03058_175ec96bf62a64a4e7c0d9191fcb5: After the acquisition, we cut out regions with obvious motions (
elements.2211.03058_001b1597ee8a6f1c6a654c5cc1d37: pixels) and light condition changes, crop them into 4K image pairs and use a global 2D translation to align the cropped image pairs

elements.2211.03058_6e6aecb92d24e68c161c39f6b9a80: 4K SDRTV-HDRTV pairs with misalignment no more than 1 pixel as our labeled inference dataset

elements.2211.03058_f7de53550f6cb2f6b97165a1ed4db: , our RealHDRTV dataset, we evaluate the reconstructed HDRTVs using several metrics for fidelity, perceptual quality and color difference
elements.2211.03058_e203eb0e64ddf4649e63659d6355f: For fidelity, we use PSNR, mPSNR
elements.2211.03058_ab4e9d029ede322340af83870ac29: For perceptual quality, we use HDR-VDP-3
elements.2211.03058_eb44f5060b7c409eda73c811b7ff0: because they are highly correlated to the human perceptions for HDRTVs
elements.2211.03058_2f8bc6be25490e9b8221f57fa3bd8: which is designed for the color gamut BT.2020
elements.2211.03058_252692fe6a8c73f886a83e3dc933e: For visualization, we visualize HDRTVs without any post-processing following
elements.2211.03058_50e85d28c3cab774aaeeace80b44b: to keep the details in extreme-light regions.
elements.2211.03058_659cf1101572948c389fd03627fbb: Quantitative results on the generalization to our RealHDRTV dataset are shown in Table
elements.2211.03058_7b41e4668b66e333b9f9f4027d3d2: As we can see, for each network, the version trained by paired data synthesized by our method works the best in terms of every evaluation metric and achieves significant gains over the baseline methods
elements.2211.03058_6feb76f27fc2122c7ff34015406f0: , the state-of-the-art HDRTV reconstruction network, as an example, compared with the best-performed TMO Hable
elements.2211.03058_ec016587f8126a21fd6606bb98e43: , our method gains 2.60dB, 0.014 and 6.7 in terms of PSNR, SR-SIM and
elements.2211.03058_87089789aaff13a728d693ce5f40e: Such results validate that, with our synthesized training data, the networks can generalize well to the real-world SDRTVs
elements.2211.03058_29e6bd6adac239854c62c88ea1ec5: Note that there are still small misalignment between SDRTVs and HDRTVs within this dataset, the absolute full-reference metrics will be not as high as those well-aligned ones, but the metric difference can still reflect the superiority of our method.

elements.2211.03058_596cc72b58fe4044da9d02f8d1e91: We also show some visual examples in Fig.
elements.2211.03058_173cebfbc84744b089bbc4e8b315a: , we can see that, with CycleGAN, the reconstructed HDRTVs suffer from severe color bias and lose details at extreme light regions, which is consistent with the results shown in Table
elements.2211.03058_59cb6aa71a1786871fe9321b6f99c: Although the cycle consistency has been proved useful for style transfer
elements.2211.03058_353c42d6e2cb684f7cca30fd3b88a: , the real-world HDRTV reconstruction does not work well with such constraint
elements.2211.03058_d1569e58d15df25b802b756198159: In contrast, by exploiting several tone mapping priors as both constraints and guidance, our method can perform pretty well in real-world cases
elements.2211.03058_9013f44783db019a86d7ab84f1acd: While the networks trained with data synthesized by other methods show weak ability to recover the low-light region and expand the accurate color gamut, the network trained by our dataset show significant advantage over them and produce results much more close to the ground truth.
elements.2211.03058_7a9f22e59b5a33e9c8a95c35d591f: We also reveal the generalization ability of the networks trained with our synthesized dataset in a more open situation, we compare the performance of three versions (Hable, Youtube, and Ours) of the network HDRTVNet-AGCM on the unlabeled inference dataset

elements.2211.03058_e5e99a0bb1775ab19962d3fedf27c: We conduct a user study on the reconstructed HDRTVs with
elements.2211.03058_5c521a7bcc8310e9ae07da7620121: Each participant is asked to make pairwise comparisons on
elements.2211.03058_bf5467ab812f125c63e850e2b30de: results of each image displayed on an HDR-TV in a darkroom
elements.2211.03058_33771886f052d3ba771e0b3cde0f1: The detailed settings and device parameters can be found in the supplementary material
elements.2211.03058_dabe84e43ee95157f4847aad3f2fa: We show the preference matrix in Table
elements.2211.03058_442786bea269969446fb3716faed6: We can see that, when comparing our method with the best-performed TMOs,
elements.2211.03058_1cf272845e413b8f19ec08dd1d5cb: of users prefer our results, respectively.
elements.2211.03058_214874d1e96dd3c429c28d9865b3b: We also show some examples for visual comparison in Fig.
elements.2211.03058_5727946058922f7050d235cbda441: We can find that while the networks trained by Youtube's and Hable's data has less awareness of high-light (the top two) and low-light (the bottom two) regions, the network trained by our data can enrich the details as well as preserve continuous structures
elements.2211.03058_d100c834a360bc3b68f018551bbde: To sum up, while the training datasets for both our data synthesis network and the HDRTV reconstruction networks have no overlap with our RealHDRTV and
elements.2211.03058_36fa979193d866979342088d6c979: datasets, the networks trained by our data show notable performance gains in both numerical and visual comparisons as well as the user study
elements.2211.03058_094fbb177b303a18354e2378bf404: It indicates that, our approach can serve as a better solution for paired SDRTV-HDRTV synthesis towards real-world HDRTV reconstruction.
elements.2211.03058_ef682af89dd4942ba2fbbe81fd43e: We also evaluate the quality of synthesized SDRTVs
elements.2211.03058_a9fe7d44881dfbef36559b5d13839: Specifically, we feed the HDRTVs in our RealHDRTV dataset into our well-trained data synthesis network and evaluate the distance and difference between our synthesized SDRTVs and the real-world ones
elements.2211.03058_4d232e95415cff1db86598c163ebd: We evaluate the distances in terms of fidelity metrics PSNR and SSIM
elements.2211.03058_3ba47bbd1a752242b1c0eacb0149e: and color difference for color gamut BT.709,
elements.2211.03058_35f1c8f746992f7ea822787fa0146: to evaluate the ability of information preservation from HDRTVs
elements.2211.03058_ae5be20eee6d4934098d61914b2d6: We involve several representative TMOs for the comparison as shown in Table

elements.2211.03058_8b9476c955c92690de07d254368b7: We can observe that, although the state-of-the-art TMOs like Liang
elements.2211.03058_48f193e9bda5fc811e1d6f5cab67b: have significantly high TMQI values, the SDRTVs generated by them are far away from the ground truth SDRTVs
elements.2211.03058_85d27b17da44fac5da84137ff133b: On the contrary, the SDRTVs generated by our method shows much better fidelity and color accuracy by 1.27dB gain of PSNR and 0.58 drop of CIEDE-2000 compared with the best performed TMO Hable
elements.2211.03058_cb8f8992dba5fe42a4ddc6bec60c2: Such results are consistent with what we observe in Fig.
elements.2211.03058_7a941046e06a0c09f3c24e1931a55: and interestingly, we find that our average TMQI value is pretty close to the turning point in the scatters,
elements.2211.03058_3f3f8b4a5cb1d6836ea3fed28f251: It reveals our success on avoiding information over-preservation.
elements.2211.03058_f4d061aa4bdde5cd53d198d4e6c41: We can see that, compared with the ground truth SDRTVs, the information over-preservation (
elements.2211.03058_bd39f988fe2757e99d6252a87cbbc: , Clip and Rank for the top example), color bias (
elements.2211.03058_cf732a8ca9f0f4c8b954e57cad41e: , Hable and UTMNet for the middle example) and artifacts (
elements.2211.03058_7e7df54b86efddd1a02a79dbff46f: , Reinhard and Linear in the bottom example) are very obvious
elements.2211.03058_162da584e3a6112b5660711fe91cc: Meanwhile, our method can selectively preserve the information from the HDRTVs, transform color gamut accurately and avoid the artifacts.
elements.2211.03058_014050090fa58ff6abbe7c84057e2: With the evaluations on synthesized SDRTVs, we'd like to show some ablation studies about the network structures and loss functions, particularly the effects on the tone mapping priors we utilize in our framework
elements.2211.03058_9a0358cb58c35b55ca8fe5ebf1f3f: We compare the values of PSNR and CIEDE-2000
elements.2211.03058_40a3c29ae1928dca3fe82c8ed2927: calculated on the synthesized SDRTVs by different variants in Table
elements.2211.03058_70a0b4b5b1aa8e2d55608a9b2e431: and show visual comparisons in the supplementary material.
elements.2211.03058_7537d85a5223dbfa8ae2b99c38946: We conduct several experiments to validate the effectiveness of tone mapping priors used for network designs
elements.2211.03058_b730de168d0ae0681651fac07b765: Specifically, we remove the condition network or use the input HDRTV itself to replace the condition tone mapping results to keep the parameter numbers the same
elements.2211.03058_2a1582d05ea0a13f0e443c7b40989: that the condition network as well as the condition tone mapping results make very important contributions to more accurate real-world data synthesis
elements.2211.03058_519e37a839183a8f5f36713557418: , Clip, Linear, Reinhard and Youtube we use here shows different performance advantages at different regions
elements.2211.03058_da844537321948e92e813ca14e572: For example, Linear performs very well at losing low-light details
elements.2211.03058_2b65f30b7513bfa0c76a85e8afa6b: Meanwhile, our method apparently take merits of these conditions, which validates the importance of them again
elements.2211.03058_61c2ecd89cd2f5f950ae20ebbe548: In addition, the ablation results on only the global or local stream validate the effectiveness of combining them, the visual results in the supplementary material also validate the advantages of these two streams on global and local mappings, respectively.
elements.2211.03058_d2cfe08b2a701daca0c5e9e290ad3: As we can see in the table, if we only use
elements.2211.03058_332aad709b314fc9262c0af2bfc7c: to train the network, the network will synthesize SDRTVs far away from the real-world ones due to the lack of content and structure constraints
elements.2211.03058_1f7b7df2c78931fa5ce721d484aaf: However, it does not mean that
elements.2211.03058_5084f62b031ae83aabe54c86b8c35: is useless, we can see that with the help of
elements.2211.03058_1a967b5c410c7d967ab9906ec4dfe: In addition, to show the impacts on the involved TMOs for
elements.2211.03058_db5e652f0c502d920b279b85a7e8e: loss function between the tone mapping results of each TMO as the content loss to replace
elements.2211.03058_16d884337288ae7de05f167c1cc40: As we can see in the table, with either TMO as the supervisor, the network performance will be inferior than our
elements.2211.03058_268f86b86c26129e76ed2dc4a0312: Such results validate the effectiveness of our region-aware content loss.

elements.2211.03058_e67444b9758200257b25b3ec3c44c: In this paper, we propose a data synthesis approach to synthesize realistic SDRTV-HDRTV pairs for the training of HDRTV reconstruction networks to benefit their generalization ability on real-world cases
elements.2211.03058_401baf5fd00be04ef8108ffb4e79d: Through statistical and visual analysis, we observe that, existing TMOs suffer from several drawbacks on the modeling of HDRTV-to-SDRTV including information over-preservation, color bias and artifacts
elements.2211.03058_61cdb83c4969cacc39c4425071a9f: To solve this problem, we propose a learning-based SDRTV data synthesis to learn the aspects of real-world SDRTVs
elements.2211.03058_2b66140494cf46bcdec6b8fe6ddc3: We integrate several tone mapping priors into both network structures and loss functions to benefit the learning
elements.2211.03058_318cef270645cbd76a643e02ec314: Experimental results on our collected labeled and unlabeled datasets validate that, the HDRTV reconstruction networks trained by our synthesized dataset can generalize significantly better than other methods
elements.2211.03058_472461bd19326d2929e5a828d116a: In addition, we believe that integrating degradation priors into degradation learning framework may also be promoted to benefit other low-level vision tasks
elements.2211.03058_610401eada56eeaa83633315b24c4: In the future, we also want to use our framework on MindSpore
elements.2211.03058_44f9aa894f5255f2c6195abfa2c0a: , which is a new deep learning computing framework.
elements.2211.03058_5536ac0f14ddf6361ca919a2581e2: We acknowledge funding from National Key R
elements.2211.03058_28d6a113922ebb74deada2ef3088c: D Program of China under Grant 2017YFA0700800, and National Natural Science Foundation of China under Grants 62131003 and 62021001.
